titlStmt.titl: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD

citation.biblCit: Huang, Vivian; Elahi, Shokrollah; Madsen, Karen; Fedorak, Richard; Dieleman, Levinus; Wine, Eytan; Lumb, Rowan, 2016, "Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10902, UAL Dataverse, V2

titlStmt.titl: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD

prodStmt.producer: Preconception and Pregnancy in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Clinical Research Program

stdyInfo.abstract: The objective of this study was to evaluate whether a FCP measurement in the 2nd or 3rd trimester of pregnancy in women with IBD can predict preterm delivery.

sumDscr.universe: Adult women with IBD enrolled in the Preconception and Pregnancy in IBD clinic and healthy volunteers.

dataColl.frequenc: Data was collected at each clinical visit.
dataColl.sampProc: 25 study participants were recruited through convenience sample.

sources.srcChar: Clinical disease activity scores (modified Harvey Bradshaw Index (mHBI) for Crohn's disease and partial Mayo (pMayo) for ulcerative colitis) were obtained at each study visit. C-reactive protein and Fecal calprotectin were analysed: patients collected a first morning stool sample, which was analyzed for FCP using the Quantum Blue high range reader. Delivery outcomes (preterm (less than 37 weeks) and full term (37 or more weeks) and delivery method) were also obtained after birth.

dataColl.collMode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Physical measurements and tests

useStmt.conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. Only researchers with REB-approved projects may be permitted access to the deidentified data. A basic data sharing agreement form is required (ie. Agree to not attempt to re-identify the records so as to relate the information on the file to a particular person). The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.

othrStdyMat.relStdy: Effects of Maternal IBD and IBD Breast Milk on Neonatal Gut Microbiome and Intestinal Inflammation

otherMat.txt: "Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD" poster presentation. The presentation contains aggregate data tables.
